Monte Carlo Framework for margot

Source: R/margot-monte-carlo.R
margot_monte_carlo.Rd

This file implements Monte Carlo simulation capabilities for evaluating statistical estimators under various shadowing conditions. Run Monte Carlo simulation to evaluate estimator performance

Usage

margot_monte_carlo(
  n_reps = 500,
  n_per_rep = 1000,
  dgp_params = list(),
  shadows = list(),
  estimator_fn = NULL,
  truth_fn = NULL,
  extract_fn = NULL,
  parallel = FALSE,
  n_cores = NULL,
  seed = NULL,
  verbose = TRUE,
  save_data = FALSE
)

Arguments

n_reps

Number of Monte Carlo replications

n_per_rep

Sample size per replication

dgp_params

List of parameters for margot_simulate_causal()

shadows

List of shadow objects to apply to the data

estimator_fn

Function that takes data and returns estimate(s)

truth_fn

Optional function to compute true parameter value

extract_fn

Optional function to extract additional information

parallel

Logical, use parallel processing?

n_cores

Number of cores for parallel processing

seed

Random seed

verbose

Print progress?

save_data

Logical, save datasets from each replication?

Value

Object of class "margot_mc_results" with simulation results

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Define estimator
my_estimator <- function(data) {
  fit <- lm(t3_y ~ t2_a + t1_a + b1, data = data)
  list(
    estimate = coef(fit)["t2_a"],
    se = sqrt(diag(vcov(fit)))["t2_a"],
    converged = TRUE
  )
}

# Run simulation
results <- margot_monte_carlo(
  n_reps = 500,
  n_per_rep = 1000,
  dgp_params = list(
    waves = 3,
    params = list(a_lag_y_coef = 0.3)
  ),
  estimator_fn = my_estimator
)
} # }
